## Research interests

### Graphical Models with Applications in Ecology

Application of **Gaussian Graphical Models** for investigating the structure of soil arthropods communities, and for studying the impact of various factors on the edaphic biodiversity of agroecosystems, in order to provide useful tools to support the decisions in the management and protection of biodiversity.

### Mixture Models for Ordinal Data

Improvement and application of models within the so-called **CUB (Combination of discrete Uniform and shifted Binomial random variables) class of Models**, which allows for the measurement of two latent traits: feeling and uncertainty. These models have broad applications, including in the fields of measuring visitor experience, sports analytics, and sensory analysis.
A first contribution in this field consisted in defining and studying the equivalence between the basic CUB and the CUM (Combination of discrete Uniform and linearly transformed Multinomial random variables). The second contribution consisted in developing a Multivariate CUB Model and a **Model-based Clustering** based on it.
